instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A2159: What is A2159? A2159 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3301, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01598..
definitions.820-01598A: What is 820-01598A? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
I've done something stupid :-). I have tested a new display on the <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> mbp and suddenly I lost the screen and plug off the connector. since it can not boot more than to 0.330amp and drops back to 0.160 amp. And stats here. trackpad clicks and the fan turns. there is black screen. I have tried to install new DFU but it can not get it into DFU. it takes 18.96 (lower than normal - no battery) volts and 0.160 amp. the board is completely clean and had no damage before display change. is there anyone who can give a hint/help a newbeeee like me :-).
With battery it pulls over 2.2 amps and 20.3 volt. 
i will be greatfull and are there any special lines I need to watch out for?
Cheers and goodnight from Denmark:-)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
Never move LCD connector if charger, or/and battery connected.
Do you get now USB activity?
Also check for external video; internal LCD disconnected.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: Hi. I know I knowü•µ‚Ä¶ i do not have any activity on USB and no external videoüòÖ

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
ALS and FTCAM SCL/SDA lines go directly to T2.
T2 may be now damaged, if machine is not recognized in DFU.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
Thank you 2informaticos. You are probably right as allways. Thank you again for you help and adviceüôè
have a good day - Greetings from Denmark.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: One last question for now:-) 2informaticos:-). I have read a post where you describe how to put a logicboard in DFU without the keyboard. I Can not find that thread. Would you be kind explain it to me? Thank you in advanced

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
T2 has a dedicated line to force it in DFU mod; usually named <SIGNAL>SOC_FORCE_DFU</SIGNAL>.
You can use SE032 pads.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: Thank you 2informaticos. I managed to get the device in DFU revive it. That went well but I still need power for backlight on keyboard and picture on internal and external screenü•µ. Trackpad is tippin.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: Which big coils get voltage on the MLB?

threads.message: Please take a look at enclosed picture[ATTACH type="full"]60377[/ATTACH]

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: I might have lost a few. Just let me know if you need further informations:-)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
What about L7702 and L7210/20?
Also check page 73.

BTW, no need to check different coils which are connected together on their output; one is good enough to check.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
Sorry I forgot to write you I only wrote the ones with voltageüòÖ
L7702 = 0.00
L7210/20 0.00
L8100 = 0.00

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
Check diode mode on them.
Also measure voltage power and enable signals on their chips.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
I have messured. I hope you will be able to understand my results:
<CHIP>U8110</CHIP>=EN 3.27volt Normal.
<CHIP>U7710</CHIP>=EN 0.00 volt 
<CHIP>U7712</CHIP>=Pin 5 Pp3v3 = 3.29 volt
-          = Pin 4 PVCCEDRAMS0 0.00 volt
<CHIP>U7712</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7710</CHIP> changed without result
<CHIP>U7220</CHIP>=VIN=12.54 volt
I am working but I think I have lost my thread.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
Why did you change a chip if doesn't receive the enable signal?

L7210/20 voltage is not expected untill all other voltages appear.
L8100 must be there even in S3 state.
I didn't see diode mode readings for L7702 and L8100.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
I understand your question about changing a chip without EN voltage. I lost my mind. I do not get why <CHIP>U7711</CHIP> () and <CHIP>U7712</CHIP> have a EN of 3.29 but why do they not work as <CHIP>U8112</CHIP>/11. They 8112/8111 have voltage on pin 5/6/4/3 as well‚Ä¶. <CHIP>U7711</CHIP>/12 does not
L8100 1.18 volt
L8100 diode 258
L7702 diode 033

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: <CHIP>U7710</CHIP> is wrong on earlier mentioned‚Ä¶ pin 13/14 get 5.06 voltage. Sorry for that!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
Pin 13 = vcc
Pin 14 = pvcc
Pin 3 = pvccedrams0 EN FILT BUF = 0.00 vol

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
You've said 0V before on L8100.
1.18V is good voltage.

If no important data on the machine, try DFU restore, instead of revive.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: Maybe it is a ‚Äúdead fish‚Äù or dead AppleüòÖ. I have restored it with success but still no image on internal and external display. No light in CAPS-log but trackpad still clickin‚Äô boots to 0.350 amp and returns fast to .153 amps and stay here. Cpu low temp rise. Thank you for your help

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message:
Trackpad click is not a life proof for these machines.
Once actuator coils get voltage, you will note the click at the finger; even CPU is not powered up.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2159</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598A</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> 18.93v/0.160amp no boot
threads.message: Thank you again. If I find a solution I will let you know. It could be a dead one this time. Is it possible to restore T2 if the CPU is dead?
